There is a popular song often
heard which contains the words
what will it matter a hundred
years from today"


Have you ever stopped and
thought that some small incident
might be written and recalled
century from today. Some item
of little consequence at this mo-
ment will be remembered when
all of our epitaphs have been
worn away by winds and rains.


Things which are prominent
now will have vanished. Days
which are SO important now will
have been forgotten. Events
which we hold near and dear will
be less than the wisp of smoke
which rises from a faraway CHM
ney.


While browsing through his
torical summary in our bookcase,
turned to several pages con-
tanning notes on 1864. There we're
recorded events of three hundred
years past which we're startling.


Our country which is such a
world power today was mere
territory being settled by people
from France, England. Holland
and Spain.


New France and New Neither
lands had been duly organized.
New Netherlands stretched from
Connecticut to the Delaware Ri
vers. 1t included parts of Maine
outward to Cape Cod.


New France was vast expanse
of land including part Of Canada
and most of the Central and some
areas of the South.


Before 1864 ended the Dutch
lost control of the New Neither
lands and the English won con-
troll. England renamed the area
New York honoring the King
James brother, the Duke ofYork.


Just for the record Fort Orange
which held the area guards and
soldiers of the Dutch colony was
renamed Albany as the English
made haste to erase the Dutch
titles.


The city of New Amsterdam
became New York and the start
of a great urban center began.


Today New York is probably
the greatest metropolitan area
in the United States loops. my Los
Angeles and San Francisco
friends are dissenting).


All roads lead to 1t. All routes
of transportation can originate
or terminate there. Even though
Hollywood is the mecca for would
be film actors and actresses.


New York has a monopoly on
legitimate theaters and opera and
books and novels and jazz bands
and ballet and skyscrapers and
. 0


New York is a wonderful town.
AS the Worlds Fair fever grows
= New York will again become
the main attraction not only for
the 8 millions who live there
but for 80 millions more who
will visit the fair.


When the historical Summar-
les of 1854 are studied l wonder
what will New York be called7
wonder what will be written
on a page or town about the great
city, Will todays newscast have
the item7 Will the gigantic fair
become lost in the shuttle of the
pages Of timer


Are the time capsules and his
tory keeping vaults worth all Of
our efforts7 Will the men of
three centuries in the future be
able to decipher our language7


MORAL-You can be sure
no one will care one hundred.

NATIONAL RESENTATIVE
AMALGAMATEO PUBLISHERS
$40 MADISON AVE.


NEW YORK ", NY.
